references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a foundational model for vision-language tasks, heavily influencing the current MLLM-based REG methods.

references.paper_title: Llama: Open and efficient foundation language models
references.reason: This paper introduces LLaMA, a powerful and efficient large language model, serving as the base for many current MLLM models used in REG.
This is a seminal work in referring expression generation (REG) that focuses on modeling context, a crucial aspect addressed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Modeling context between objects for referring expression understanding
references.reason: This paper focuses on context modeling in referring expression understanding (REU), which is directly relevant to the REG task tackled in the current paper.
This paper addresses the issue of hallucination in image captioning, a problem directly related to the challenges of hallucination in MLLM-based REG addressed in the current paper.
